section.name: Cayenne News
section.p: June 16: Cayenne Alpha1 Is Out. Download now the first "official" Cayenne release. Source and binary packages can be found here. Release notes are located here.

March 16: Cayenne at SourceForge and Freshmeat. Cayenne is still hosted at objectstyle.org, but we also registered the project at SourceForge.net. Bug tracking, CVS and downloads will be performed from SourceForge. Also Cayenne is registered at Freshmeat.net to make release announcements.

section.name: Welcome to Cayenne
section.p: Welcome to Cayenne. Our goal is to provide Java developers with opensource tools to access relational databases in an object-oriented way.

Cayenne includes a framework that adds persistence features to Java objects. It allows mapping classes to database tables. Queries and updates (including atomic updates of all modified objects) are done with a single method call. This is a big advantage over writing SQL code in your Java program. Cayenne also provides GUI mapping tool (called CayenneModeler) to reverse-engineer RDBMS schema and create "data maps" - XML files that contain mapping between the database and Java classes. CayenneModeler can also generate Java classes source code to use in your Java application.

Cayenne is an opensource project and therefore encourages developer and user community to participate in development, testing and writing documentation. This way we can produce a better product that will benefit its contributors as well as everybody else.

section.name: Status and History
section.p: Idea of Cayenne was conceived back in April 2001 by a group of developers in Atlanta, USA. Current version is based on that original idea and is under active development since December 2001. Current Cayenne version is 1.0a1 (alpha). It can be downloaded from here.
